title: 115_hr1728
content: BOUNDARY MODIFICATION, MORLEY NELSON SNAKE RIVER BIRDS OF PREY NATIONAL CONSERVATION AREA, IDAHO. The curr_chunk provides definitions for terms related to the Morley Nelson Snake River Birds of Prey National Conservation Area, including Conservation Area, Gateway West, Map, Sage-grouse species, and Secretary. It also outlines the modification of the Conservation Area boundary. The Conservation Area boundary is modified to include approximately 4726 acres of BLM Administered Lands and 86 acres of BOR Administered Lands, while excluding approximately 761 acres of land along the Gateway West Transmission line. The West Transmission Line will be sited within 500 feet of the existing Summer Lake Transmission Line. The Secretary will issue a right-of-way for construction and maintenance of transmission lines, including fire prevention activities. The Secretary will issue a right-of-way for the Gateway West transmission lines, with conditions aligned with Alternative 1 routes. Mitigation and conservation measures will be in accordance with the Federal Land Policy and Management Act, with a stipulated cost limit for Compensatory Mitigation and Enhancement. Gateway West will contribute $2,000 per acre for conservation in the Conservation Area during construction of Segment 8 and Segment 9. They will also cover all costs associated with boundary modifications. The Secretary will administer the lands as per the Federal Land Policy and Management Act. The Secretary will administer the lands in the Conservation Area in accordance with Public Law 103-64 and the National Landscape Conservation System. Administrative jurisdiction over 86 acres of land is transferred from the Bureau of Reclamation to the Bureau of Land Management. A map will be available for public inspection, and a management plan amendment will address long-term management of the lands. The Secretary will manage the lands in the Conservation Area as per Public Law 103-64 and this section. Livestock grazing, motorized access on existing roads, and hunting/fishing will be allowed on the described lands, subject to reasonable regulations. The Cotterel Wind Power Project area, approximately 203 acres of Federal land, is prohibited from being used for wind electricity production. The Secretary of the Interior will establish a Bureau of Land Management Foundation as a charitable corporation to address specific challenges such as reclamation of contaminated lands, wild horse management, responsible development techniques, conservation activities, and cataloging historical treasures on public lands.
